benefits.title: Lipid-modifying effects of krill oil vs fish oil: a network meta-analysis.
benefits.summary: Krill oil and fish oil have similar lipid-modifying effects, with the reduction in triglycerides depending on the dose of n-3 fatty acids consumed.

benefits.title: Antarctic Krill (Euphausia superba) Oil: A Comprehensive Review of Chemical Composition, Extraction Technologies, Health Benefits, and Current Applications.
benefits.summary: Krill oil has various health benefits, including anti-inflammatory effects, cardiovascular disease prevention, women's health, neuroprotection, and anticancer activities.
benefits.journal: Comprehensive reviews in food science and food safety

benefits.title: Krill Products: An Overview of Animal Studies
benefits.summary: Krill oil has potential health benefits in animal models for obesity, depression, myocardial infarction, chronic low-grade and ulcerative inflammation.

benefits.title: Can krill oil be of use for counteracting neuroinflammatory processes induced by high fat diet and aging?
benefits.summary: Krill oil has been reported to improve spatial memory, learning, memory loss, systemic inflammation, and depression symptoms.

benefits.title: Alterations of the brain proteome and gut microbiota in D-galactose-induced brain aging mice with krill oil supplementation.
benefits.summary: Krill oil supplementation has beneficial effects against D-galactose-induced brain aging, decreasing protein expression related to calcium signaling and increasing dopamine levels.
benefits.journal: Journal of agricultural and food chemistry

benefits.title: Advances in Technologies for Highly Active Omega-3 Fatty Acids from Krill Oil: Clinical Applications
benefits.summary: Krill oil has shown metabolic, anti-inflammatory, neuroprotective, chemo preventive, and ergogenic effects in preclinical and clinical studies.

benefits.title: Effects of Antarctic Krill Products on Feed Intake, Growth Performance, Fillet Quality, and Health in Salmonids
benefits.summary: Feeding salmonids krill products improves growth performance, fillet quality, and health benefits, such as reducing fat accumulation in liver and intestinal tissues.

benefits.title: Euphausia pacifica (North Pacific Krill): Review of Chemical Features and Potential Benefits of 8-HEPE against Metabolic Syndrome, Dyslipidemia, NAFLD, and Atherosclerosis
benefits.summary: Krill oil's 8-HEPE has beneficial effects against metabolic syndrome, dyslipidemia, NAFLD, and atherosclerosis in mice.

benefits.title: A Brief Review of Krill Oil History, Research, and the Commercial Market
benefits.summary: Krill oil is viewed as a viable alternative to fish oil for delivering health benefits associated with omega-3 fatty acids EPA and DHA, such as managing hyperlipidemia, inflammation, and arthritis.

benefits.title: The effect of krill oil on longevity and locomotion: a pilot study.
benefits.summary: Krill oil increases survival, head thrashes, and body bends in impaired C. elegans, and ameliorates energy metabolism and alleviates oxidative stress and excitotoxicity.

side effects.title: Metabolic fate (absorption, β-oxidation and deposition) of long-chain n-3 fatty acids is affected by sex and by the oil source (krill oil or fish oil) in the rat
side effects.summary: Krill oil leads to greater deposition of DPA and DHA in rats compared to fish oil, due to a difference in metabolic fate (anabolism vs. catabolism).

side effects.title: Krill Oil Supplementation Improves Dyslipidemia and Lowers Body Weight in Mice Fed a High-Fat Diet Through Activation of AMP-Activated Protein Kinase.
side effects.summary: Krill oil supplementation in mice fed a high-fat diet resulted in 15% lower body weight gain and improved dyslipidemia, triglyceride, and low-density lipoprotein-cholesterol levels.

side effects.title: Dietary krill oil supplementation reduces hepatic steatosis, glycemia, and hypercholesterolemia in high-fat-fed mice.
side effects.summary: Dietary krill oil supplementation reduces hepatic steatosis, glycemia, and hypercholesterolemia in high-fat-fed mice.
side effects.journal: Journal of agricultural and food chemistry

side effects.title: Effects of krill oil containing n-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids in phospholipid form on human brain function: a randomized controlled trial in healthy elderly volunteers
side effects.summary: Krill oil, rich in n-3 PUFAs incorporated in phosphatidylcholine, activates cognitive function in the elderly, especially when incorporated into phosphatidylcholine.

side effects.title: Comparison of solvents for extraction of krill oil from krill meal: Lipid yield, phospholipids content, fatty acids composition and minor components.
side effects.summary: Krill oil extracted with ethanol and isopropanol led to higher lipid yields and phospholipid contents, but lower contents of minor components like sterols, astaxanthin, and vitamin A.

side effects.title: Krill oil extract suppresses cell growth and induces apoptosis of human colorectal cancer cells
side effects.summary: Krill oil extract suppresses cell proliferation and induces apoptosis in human colorectal cancer cells through its bioactive constituent EPA.

side effects.title: Krill oil supplementation increases plasma concentrations of eicosapentaenoic and docosahexaenoic acids in overweight and obese men and women.
side effects.summary: Krill oil supplementation increased plasma EPA and DHA and was well tolerated, with no indication of adverse effects on safety parameters.

side effects.title: Krill oil extract suppresses the proliferation of colorectal cancer cells through activation of caspase 3/9
side effects.summary: Krill oil extract suppresses the proliferation of colorectal cancer cells through activation of caspase 3/9.

side effects.title: Krill oil alleviates oxidative stress, iron accumulation and fibrosis in the liver and spleen of iron-overload rats
side effects.summary: Krill oil improved liver and spleen features, decreased iron levels, and restored the balance between oxidants and antioxidants in iron overload-induced toxicity.

dosage.title: Modulation of the Gut Microbiota by Krill Oil in Mice Fed a High-Sugar High-Fat Diet
dosage.summary: Krill oil dosages in this study were low (100 Î14g/g), moderate (200 Î14g/g), and high (600 Î14g/g), with dose-dependent modulation of gut microbiota.

dosage.title: The Effect of Krill Oil Supplementation on Exercise Performance and Markers of Immune Function
dosage.summary: Krill oil supplementation (2g/day) for 6 weeks can increase PBMC IL-2 production and NK cell cytotoxic activity 3h post-exercise in both healthy young males and females.

dosage.title: Krill oil alleviates oxidative stress, iron accumulation and fibrosis in the liver and spleen of iron-overload rats
dosage.summary: Krill oil (40 mg/kg) treatment for an extra 8 weeks improved liver and spleen features in iron-overload rats.

dosage.title: Effects of Supplementation with Neptune Krill Oil (Euphasia Superba) on Selected Redox Parameters and Pro-Inflammatory Markers in Athletes during Exhaustive Exercise
dosage.summary: Supplementation with Krill oil (1g per day) in trained rowers diminished post exercise oxidative damage to erythrocytes during recovery.

dosage.title: Krill oil supplementation lowers serum triglycerides without increasing low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in adults with borderline high or high triglyceride levels.
dosage.summary: Krill oil supplementation at 0.5, 1, 2, or 4 g/day significantly reduced serum triglyceride levels by 10.2%.

dosage.title: Metabolic fate (absorption, β-oxidation and deposition) of long-chain n-3 fatty acids is affected by sex and by the oil source (krill oil or fish oil) in the rat
dosage.summary: The EPA+DHA+DPA content of krill oil is 138 mg/g of diet, while fish oil has 161 mg/g of diet.

dosage.title: Effects of krill oil and lean and fatty fish on cardiovascular risk markers: a randomised controlled trial
dosage.summary: Krill oil supplementation resulted in health-beneficial effects, with a weekly intake of marine n-3 fatty acids of 4103 and 4654 mg, respectively.

dosage.title: Krill oil supplementation increases plasma concentrations of eicosapentaenoic and docosahexaenoic acids in overweight and obese men and women.
dosage.summary: 2 g/d of krill oil supplementation increased plasma EPA and DHA and was well tolerated, with no indication of adverse effects on safety parameters.

dosage.title: A Randomized, Double-Masked, Placebo-Controlled Clinical Trial of Two Forms of Omega-3 Supplements for Treating Dry Eye Disease.
dosage.summary: Krill oil dosage in the study was 945 mg/day EPA + 510 mg/day DHA.

dosage.title: Antarctic Krill Oil Diet Protects against Lipopolysaccharide-Induced Oxidative Stress, Neuroinflammation and Cognitive Impairment
dosage.summary: Krill oil diet (80 mg/kg/day for one month) prevented amyloidogenesis and cognitive impairment induced by LPS in AD mice model.
